results.title: The Wynns, winegrowers
results.brief_description: Traces the growth of the Wynn’s family wind business over 50 years. From small beginnings they now own large vineyards in various parts of Australia. Illustrates the organisation of the entire industry from growing the grapes to marketing bottled table wines, champagne and flagons.

results.title: The Wyeth phenomenon
results.brief_description: In this film, critics and admirers discuss Mr. Wyeth’s style and subjects and try their hand at uncovering meanings in his art. Discussing the artist are the art critic of “The New York Times”, John Canady; artist Henriette Hurd (Wyeth’s sister); and Wyeth’s son, James.

results.title: The Wrong Man
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Herbert Coleman and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A tense thriller based on the true story of an honest man mistaken for an armed robber. When Christopher Balestrero (Henry Fonda) decides to borrow money on his wife’s insurance policy to pay urgent debts, a tragic chain of events is set off because the staff of the insurance company believe him to be a man who previously held up their office.

results.title: The Worst witch
results.brief_description: Mildred Hubble (Fairuza Balk), a student at Miss Cackle’s International Academy for Witches, can’t do anything right. Her disastrous spell-casting constantly attracts the displeasure of her teacher, Miss Hardbroom, and the ridicule of her classmates, in particular, snobby teacher’s pet, Ethel Hallow. After Mildred accidentally turns her into a pig, Ethel decides to get her back by sabotaging her broomstick just prior to the much-anticipated Halloween celebrations. The resulting chaos forces the premature departure of the Grand Wizard (Tim Curry), and Mildred is so ashamed that she decides to run away. While flying over the countryside, she stumbles upon a coven of wicked witches, and learns of their fiendish plot to take over Miss Cackle’s Academy. Will Mildred be able to redeem herself by saving the Academy, or will she fail, and be forever known as the worst witch?

results.title: The Worlds of Rudyard Kipling
results.brief_description: The film uses over 600 still photographs to present Kipling- the poet, novelist, patriot and chauvinist- and his love of America, India and South Africa. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: The World tree: A scandinavian creation myth (K)_
results.brief_description: An art film which depicts the Scandinavian myth of Voluspa involving the opposing forces of fire and ice, the frost giant, the ice cows and the gods who created everything on Earth, including the world tree which formed a bridge between the gods and the universe they had created.
